name: Suspicious Biryani
desc: An aromatic rice dish. The rice grains are soaked in oil and have thus become translucent. Its greasy smell is rather unpleasant. A layer of oil remains on the plate even after you finish the dish... Best to stay away from greasy food for the next few days...

customize.name: Recipe: Biryani
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Biryani.

customize.name: Rice
customize.desc: A grain crop commonly found in Teyvat. People of all walks of life enjoy its distinct grainy texture. As the saying goes, "The same kind of rice can feed one hundred kinds of people."

customize.name: Raw Meat
customize.desc: A fresh chunk of meat. Handled properly, it can be used to make delicious food.

customize.name: Spice
customize.desc: A seasoning with varied flavors. It is made from dried Harra Fruits and can enrich the taste of a dish. Therefore, Sumeru locals say, "Spice goes well with anything."

customize.name: Padisarah
customize.desc: A holy and noble plant. The conditions for growth in its environment are very demanding. The flower buds can be processed to make valuable spices.

customize.name: Biryani
customize.desc: An aromatic rice dish. Stir-fry the meat such that it is crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Then stew it with condiments and long-grain rice. Sprinkle a few Padisarah petals before serving. Every grain is saturated with the aroma of fatty meat and condiments. The dish has an exquisite taste only found in Sumeru.

customize.name: Delicious Biryani
customize.desc: An aromatic rice dish. The golden crown made of long-grain rice and meat is adorned with Padisarah petals, a picture that reminds you of a desert dotted with oases. The enticing scent of spices dances across each grain of rice. Every mouthful soothes your whole body. It won't take long for a customer to empty the plate. They can' help but lick their mouth, savoring the lingering scent.

value.text: Increases all party members' DEF by 215 and healing effects by 6% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
